meanings.definition: Biogasses: plural noun - gases produced by the biological breakdown of organic matter in the absence of oxygen.
meanings.sent1: The biogasses from the compost pile smelled like rotten eggs.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use biogasses to generate electricity from waste products.
meanings.sent3: The biogasses escaped from the tank and caused quite a stink in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The biogasses bubbled up from the swamp like ghostly whispers.
meanings.sent5: The scientist explained how biogasses are a natural byproduct of decomposition.

meanings.definition: Biogasses: verb - to produce gases through the biological breakdown of organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The bacteria in the soil biogasses the organic waste into useful energy.
meanings.sent2: We can biogasses food scraps to reduce waste and create renewable energy.
meanings.sent3: The compost bin happily biogasses our kitchen leftovers into nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent4: The swamp seems to biogasses its murky secrets with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The biogassing process is essential for sustainable waste management.
